title: How to Redeem Codes on Xbox One

steps.headline: Go to the Xbox LIVE code site.
steps.description: If you're already logged into your Xbox LIVE account, doing so will bring you to a code entry field. If you aren't logged into Xbox LIVE, type in your email address, phone number, or Skype name, click Next, enter your password, and click Sign in.

steps.headline: Type the code into the text field.
steps.description: This field is the blue bar in the middle of the page. Make sure you don't leave out any characters or make any mistakes while typing your code, or it won't work.

steps.headline: Click Next.
steps.description: This button is below and right of the text field. If your code is valid, it will be applied to your Xbox LIVE account for further use.

steps.headline: Turn on your Xbox One.
steps.description: To do so, press the Xbox button on the right side of the console. You can also hold down the Xbox button in the middle of a connected controller to turn on the Xbox One.

steps.headline: Scroll over to the "Store" tab and press A.
steps.description: The "Store" tab is at the top-right side of the Xbox One menu.

steps.headline: Scroll down to Use a code and press A.
steps.description: The Use a code option is three down-arrow presses down from the top of the "Store" page.

steps.headline: Press A to bring up the keyboard.
steps.description: You should see a white field on this page; pressing A will open this field, which is the "Redeem code" field, for typing. If you want to scan a QR code instead, press B and then hold the code up to your Xbox One's Kinect camera. Your Kinect must be turned on for this to work.

steps.headline: Enter your code.
steps.description: It should be twenty-five digits long.

steps.headline: Press ☰.
steps.description: It's on the middle-right side of your Xbox One controller. Doing so will enter your code into the field.

steps.headline: Select the Redeem option and press A.
steps.description: This will submit your entered code. If the code is valid, it will automatically be applied to your Xbox LIVE account.

steps.headline: Open the Xbox app.
steps.description: It's green with a white X on it. If you haven't already downloaded it, you'll need to do so from the App Store (iPhone) or the Google Play Store (Android).

steps.headline: Tap Sign In.
steps.description: It's at the bottom of the screen.

steps.headline: Type in your Xbox Live email address.
steps.description: You'll do this in the field below the "Sign In" text.

steps.headline: Tap Next.
steps.description: This button is below the email address entry field.

steps.headline: Tap Sign In.
steps.description: It's below the password entry field.

steps.headline: Tap ☰.
steps.description: You'll see this option in the top-left corner of the screen.

steps.headline: Tap Store.
steps.description: It's in the middle of the drop-down menu.

steps.headline: Tap Redeem a code.
steps.description: You should see this option near the top of the page, just below the "Search" section.

steps.headline: Tap Next.
steps.description: It's in the bottom-right corner of the screen. Doing so will add your code to your Xbox LIVE account; the next time you sign into your Xbox One, you should see the repercussions of your code there. For example, if you added months to your LIVE subscription or you purchased DLC for a game, you'll be able to make immediate use of the code-related material (in the case of DLC, this may entail downloading it first).

text: Using the Xbox LIVE Website Go to the Xbox LIVE code site. If you're already logged into your Xbox LIVE account, doing so will bring you to a code entry field. If you aren't logged into Xbox LIVE, type in your email address, phone number, or Skype name, click Next, enter your password, and click Sign in. Type the code into the text field. This field is the blue bar in the middle of the page. Make sure you don't leave out any characters or make any mistakes while typing your code, or it won't work. Click Next. This button is below and right of the text field. If your code is valid, it will be applied to your Xbox LIVE account for further use. Using Your Xbox One Turn on your Xbox One. To do so, press the Xbox button on the right side of the console. You can also hold down the Xbox button in the middle of a connected controller to turn on the Xbox One. Scroll over to the "Store" tab and press A. The "Store" tab is at the top-right side of the Xbox One menu. Scroll down to Use a code and press A. The Use a code option is three down-arrow presses down from the top of the "Store" page. Press A to bring up the keyboard. You should see a white field on this page; pressing A will open this field, which is the "Redeem code" field, for typing. If you want to scan a QR code instead, press B and then hold the code up to your Xbox One's Kinect camera. Your Kinect must be turned on for this to work. Enter your code. It should be twenty-five digits long. Press ☰. It's on the middle-right side of your Xbox One controller. Doing so will enter your code into the field. Select the Redeem option and press A. This will submit your entered code. If the code is valid, it will automatically be applied to your Xbox LIVE account. Using the Xbox App Open the Xbox app. It's green with a white X on it. If you haven't already downloaded it, you'll need to do so from the App Store (iPhone) or the Google Play Store (Android). Tap Sign In. It's at the bottom of the screen. Type in your Xbox Live email address. You'll do this in the field below the "Sign In" text. Tap Next. This button is below the email address entry field. Type in your password.  Tap Sign In. It's below the password entry field. Tap ☰. You'll see this option in the top-left corner of the screen. Tap Store. It's in the middle of the drop-down menu. Tap Redeem a code. You should see this option near the top of the page, just below the "Search" section. Type in your 25-digit code.  Tap Next. It's in the bottom-right corner of the screen. Doing so will add your code to your Xbox LIVE account; the next time you sign into your Xbox One, you should see the repercussions of your code there. For example, if you added months to your LIVE subscription or you purchased DLC for a game, you'll be able to make immediate use of the code-related material (in the case of DLC, this may entail downloading it first).
